name: The Apple Doesn't Fall Far
description: Children from families across Starfleet have gone missing, leaving many to suspect those hostile to the Federation are targeting its greatest vulnerability. However, all may not be as it seems. Help rescue the Federation's future!
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In a Voyage Event, you will engage in Voyages with ocassional Voyage Encounters that will test proficiencies of your voyage crew.
-- In this event, Gold and Silver skills for Voyages will be as follows: SCI and ENG for Phase 1, ENG and DIP for Phase 2. 
-- Voyage Encounters take place at the following points in time: 1 minute, 5 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes, 1 hour, 1.5 hours, 2 hours, and every 2 hours after that.
-- Passing a Voyage Encounter without losing any contests raises the multiplier for Victory Points gained in contests. Losing a contest resets this multiplier.
-- Three of the following traits are randomly chosen for each Encounter: Inspiring, Explorer, Scoundrel, Casual, Playful, Hero, Marksman, Investigator. Using crew with matching traits increases their Crit Chance in contests.
-- Using any version of S. Wildman, N. Wildman, Sutter, Soong, or Caregivers will provide a bonus to antimatter and a permanent multiplier to passively gained Victory Points.
-- Using the Monaveen, La Sirena, the Intrepid-Class Ship, or ships with the Historic trait will provide a bonus to antimatter.
-- Earn Event Victory Points passively by running a voyage, and actively by winning contests during Voyage Encounters. The amount you earn increases with every Voyage Encounter passed. 
-- Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Bonus: Historic (Ship trait), S. Wildman, N. Wildman, Sutter, Soong, or Caregivers

featured_crew.name: Hanok
featured_crew.flavor: The trade minister of Karemma, Hanok, arrived on U.S.S. Defiant to resolve a trade dispute between the Karemma and the Ferengi.

action.name: Greed Leads To Misjudgment

featured_crew.name: Sutter
featured_crew.flavor: Sutter and his daughter Clara were transferred aboard two years ago. He worries about Clara’s imaginary friend.

action.name: I'm Having A Problem With Clara

featured_crew.name: Altan
featured_crew.flavor: Working with Sutra, Soong built a beacon to contact the protectors of synthetic life for the creations he considered his children.

action.name: I Suppose That's What Mothers Do

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

action.name: Make Us Proud

rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Hanok
rewards.flavor: The trade minister of Karemma, Hanok, arrived on U.S.S. Defiant to resolve a trade dispute between the Karemma and the Ferengi.

action.name: Greed Leads To Misjudgment

rewards.name: Altan
rewards.flavor: Working with Sutra, Soong built a beacon to contact the protectors of synthetic life for the creations he considered his children.

action.name: I Suppose That's What Mothers Do

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
